title: Prohibits the sale of over-the-counter weight loss supplements to minors and requires education to minors of the effects of weight loss supplements
summary: Prohibits the sale of over-the-counter weight loss supplements to minors and requires education to minors of the effects of weight loss supplements; requires store owners to post a sign of such prohibition.

       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, the general business law and  the  public
         health  law,  in  relation to prohibiting the sale of over-the-counter
         weight loss supplements to minors and requiring  educational  outreach
         to minors of the risks of weight loss supplements

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 3 and the first closing  paragraph  of  section
    2  260.21  of  the  penal law, as added by chapter 362 of the laws of 1992,
    3  are amended and a new subdivision 4 is added to read as follows:
    4    3. He sells or causes to be sold tobacco in any form to a  child  less
    5  than eighteen years old[.]; OR
    6    4.  HE SELLS OR CAUSES TO BE SOLD OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLE-
    7  MENTS IN ANY FORM TO A CHILD LESS THAN EIGHTEEN YEARS OLD.
    8    It is no defense to a prosecution pursuant  to  subdivision  three  OR
    9  FOUR of this section that the child acted as the agent or representative
   10  of another person or that the defendant dealt with the child as such.
   11    S  2. The general business law is amended by adding a new section 391-
   12  oo to read as follows:
   13    S 391-OO. REGULATION  OF  OVER-THE-COUNTER  WEIGHT  LOSS  SUPPLEMENTS;
   14  DISTRIBUTION  TO  MINORS  PROHIBITED. 1. ANY PERSON OPERATING A PLACE OF
   15  BUSINESS WHEREIN OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS  ARE  SOLD  OR
   16  OFFERED FOR SALE IS PROHIBITED FROM SELLING SUCH PRODUCTS TO INDIVIDUALS
   17  UNDER  EIGHTEEN  YEARS  OF  AGE, AND SHALL POST IN A CONSPICUOUS PLACE A
   18  SIGN UPON WHICH THERE SHALL BE IMPRINTED THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT,  "SALE
   19  OF  OVER-THE-COUNTER  WEIGHT  LOSS SUPPLEMENTS TO PERSONS UNDER EIGHTEEN
   20  YEARS OF AGE IS PROHIBITED BY LAW." SUCH SIGN  SHALL  BE  PRINTED  ON  A
   21  WHITE  CARD  IN  RED  LETTERS AT LEAST ONE-HALF INCH IN HEIGHT.  SALE OF
   22  OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS PRODUCTS IN SUCH PLACES, SHALL BE MADE ONLY

    1  TO AN INDIVIDUAL WHO DEMONSTRATES, THROUGH A DRIVER'S LICENSE  OR  OTHER
    2  PHOTOGRAPHIC IDENTIFICATION CARD ISSUED BY A GOVERNMENT ENTITY OR EDUCA-
    3  TIONAL  INSTITUTION,  THAT  THE INDIVIDUAL IS AT LEAST EIGHTEEN YEARS OF
    4  AGE.  SUCH  IDENTIFICATION  NEED  NOT  BE REQUIRED OF ANY INDIVIDUAL WHO
    5  REASONABLY APPEARS TO BE AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE YEARS  OF  AGE,  PROVIDED,
    6  HOWEVER,  THAT  SUCH  APPEARANCE  SHALL  NOT CONSTITUTE A DEFENSE IN ANY
    7  PROCEEDING ALLEGING THE SALE OF AN OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS  SUPPLE-
    8  MENT TO AN INDIVIDUAL UNDER EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
    9    2. OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS MEANS ANY PRODUCT INTENDED
   10  FOR  THE  PURPOSE  OF  WEIGHT  LOSS  THAT ARE SOLD WITHOUT THE NEED OF A
   11  PRESCRIPTION.
   12    S 3. The public health law is amended by adding a new article 13-I  to
   13  read as follows:
   14                                ARTICLE 13-I
   15           REGULATION OF OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS;
   16                      DISTRIBUTION TO MINORS PROHIBITED
   17  SECTION 1399-XX. REGULATION OF OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS;
   18                     DISTRIBUTION TO MINORS PROHIBITED.
   19          1399-YY. WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENT PUBLIC AWARENESS PROGRAM.
   20    S  1399-XX.  REGULATION  OF  OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS;
   21  DISTRIBUTION TO MINORS PROHIBITED. 1. ANY PERSON OPERATING  A  PLACE  OF
   22  BUSINESS  WHEREIN  OVER-THE-COUNTER  WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS ARE SOLD OR
   23  OFFERED FOR SALE IS PROHIBITED FROM SELLING SUCH PRODUCTS TO INDIVIDUALS
   24  UNDER EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE, AND SHALL POST IN  A  CONSPICUOUS  PLACE  A
   25  SIGN  UPON WHICH THERE SHALL BE IMPRINTED THE FOLLOWING STATEMENT, "SALE
   26  OF OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS TO  PERSONS  UNDER  EIGHTEEN
   27  YEARS  OF  AGE  IS  PROHIBITED  BY LAW." SUCH SIGN SHALL BE PRINTED ON A
   28  WHITE CARD IN RED LETTERS AT LEAST ONE-HALF  INCH  IN  HEIGHT.  SALE  OF
   29  OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS PRODUCTS IN SUCH PLACES, SHALL BE MADE ONLY
   30  TO  AN  INDIVIDUAL WHO DEMONSTRATES, THROUGH A DRIVER'S LICENSE OR OTHER
   31  PHOTOGRAPHIC IDENTIFICATION CARD ISSUED BY A GOVERNMENT ENTITY OR EDUCA-
   32  TIONAL INSTITUTION, THAT THE INDIVIDUAL IS AT LEAST  EIGHTEEN  YEARS  OF
   33  AGE.  SUCH  IDENTIFICATION  NEED  NOT  BE REQUIRED OF ANY INDIVIDUAL WHO
   34  REASONABLY APPEARS TO BE AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE YEARS  OF  AGE,  PROVIDED,
   35  HOWEVER,  THAT  SUCH  APPEARANCE  SHALL  NOT CONSTITUTE A DEFENSE IN ANY
   36  PROCEEDING ALLEGING THE SALE OF AN OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS  SUPPLE-
   37  MENT TO AN INDIVIDUAL UNDER EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
   38    2. OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENTS MEANS ANY PRODUCT INTENDED
   39  FOR  THE  PURPOSE  OF  WEIGHT  LOSS  THAT ARE SOLD WITHOUT THE NEED OF A
   40  PRESCRIPTION.
   41    S 1399-YY.  WEIGHT  LOSS  SUPPLEMENT  PUBLIC  AWARENESS  PROGRAM.  THE
   42  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  ESTABLISH A WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENT PUBLIC AWARENESS
   43  PROGRAM. 1. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL  ESTABLISH  AN  EDUCATIONAL  OUTREACH
   44  PROGRAM  FOR  WEIGHT  LOSS  SUPPLEMENT AWARENESS BY PROVIDING FOR EDUCA-
   45  TIONAL OUTREACH SERVICES TO TEENAGERS, PRE-TEENAGERS, PARENTS, SIBLINGS,
   46  TEACHERS, GUIDANCE COUNSELORS, PRINCIPALS AND SUPERINTENDENTS.
   47    2. THE COMMISSIONER, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE COMMISSIONER  OF  EDUCA-
   48  TION, SHALL PROMULGATE RULES AND REGULATIONS NECESSARY FOR THE IMPLEMEN-
   49  TATION OF SUCH OUTREACH PROGRAM, AND SHALL BE DESIGNED TO PROMOTE:
   50    (A)  INCREASED  AWARENESS  OF  THE  RISKS  ASSOCIATED WITH WEIGHT LOSS
   51  SUPPLEMENTS BY PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN WITHOUT  THE  CONSULTA-
   52  TION OF A LICENSED PHYSICIAN; AND
   53    (B)  COORDINATION OF PUBLIC AND PRIVATE EFFORTS TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL
   54  OUTREACH PROGRAMS TO MINORS, PARENTS AND EDUCATORS.

       S. 407                              3

    1    3. THE FOLLOWING STRATEGIES MAY BE USED TO RAISE PUBLIC  AWARENESS  OF
    2  THE  RISKS  ASSOCIATED  WITH  THE  USE  OF  OVER-THE-COUNTER WEIGHT LOSS
    3  SUPPLEMENTS BY PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN:
    4    (A)  OUTREACH  CAMPAIGN  UTILIZING  PRINT, RADIO AND TELEVISION PUBLIC
    5  SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS, ADVERTISEMENTS, POSTERS AND OTHER MATERIALS;
    6    (B) COMMUNITY FORUMS; AND
    7    (C) HEALTH INFORMATION AND RISK-FACTOR ASSESSMENTS AT PUBLIC EVENTS.
    8    4. THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SHALL  ASSIST  THE  DEPARTMENT  IN  THE
    9  DISTRIBUTION OF INFORMATION FOR THE WEIGHT LOSS SUPPLEMENT PUBLIC AWARE-
   10  NESS PROGRAM AS ESTABLISHED BY THIS SECTION.
   11    S 4. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   12  ing  the  date  on  which it shall have become a law; provided, however,
   13  that section three of this act shall take effect on  the  ninetieth  day
   14  after  it  shall have become a law. Effective immediately, the addition,
   15  amendment and/or repeal of any rule  or  regulation  necessary  for  the
   16  implementation  of  this  act on its effective date are authorized to be
   17  made and completed.
